articles.headline: Las Vegas Raiders QB Aidan O'Connell exits with wrist injury
articles.description: Following a 10-play, 32-yard scoring drive in the second quarter, Las Vegas Raiders backup quarterback Aidan O'Connell left the club's preseason finale against the Arizona Cardinals on Saturday at State Farm Stadium after sustaining a right wrist injury.

articles.headline: The 49ers spoil Trey Lance's return to the Bay Area with a 30-23 win over the Chargers
articles.description: — Trey Lance's return to the Bay Area led to three straight punts for the Los Angeles Chargers, who went on to lose 30-23 Saturday night to the San Francisco 49ers in the final exhibition game for both teams.

images.name: Curtis Robinson takes it to the house
images.caption: Curtis Robinson comes up with a pick-six to give the 49ers a 23-16 lead.

articles.headline: 2025 NFL preseason Week 3: Analysis, 53-man roster projections
articles.description: The final games of the 2025 preseason help flesh out key battles ahead of Tuesday's 53-man roster cuts.

images.name: Shavers Bills Bucs [608x342]
images.caption: Buffalo Bills wide receiver Tyrell Shavers scores past Tampa Bay Buccaneers cornerback Bryce Hall.

images.name: Bill Barnwell: Brian Robinson gives 49ers peace of mind
images.caption: Bill Barnwell sees a lot of upside in the 49ers' trade for running back Brian Robinson Jr.

articles.headline: San Francisco 49ers final 2025 projected roster
articles.description: The 49ers open the 2025 NFL season at the Seahawks on Sept. 7.

images.name: Why Orlovsky is hesitant about the 49ers this season
images.caption: Dan Orlovsky joins "The Pat McAfee Show" to break down the 49ers' prospects heading into the season.

articles.headline: Los Angeles Chargers final 2025 projected roster
articles.description: The Los Angeles Chargers open the 2025 NFL regular season against the Kansas City Chiefs on Sept. 5 in Sao Paulo, Brazil

images.name: Tim Hasselbeck: Losing Rashawn Slater a huge deal for Chargers
images.caption: Tim Hasselbeck breaks down what Rashawn Slater's season-ending injury means for Justin Herbert and the Chargers.

articles.headline: Tua Tagovailoa throws TD pass and is sacked twice as Dolphins beat Jaguars 14-6 to wrap preseason
articles.description: — Tua Tagovailoa threw a 25-yard touchdown pass and was sacked twice in his only action of the preseason, and the Miami Dolphins beat the Jacksonville Jaguars 14-6 on Saturday night.

images.name: Dolphins top Jaguars 14-6 in preseason finale
images.caption: Tua Tagovailoa throws a 25-yard touchdown pass, leads Miami to a 14-6 preseason victory over Jacksonville.

article.headline: With Josh Allen sitting out, Shane Buechele leads Bills to a 23-19 preseason victory over the Bucs
article.description: — Shane Buechele made the most of his first opportunity to play a full game in the NFL, showing 31 other teams what he can do.
article.linkText: With Josh Allen sitting out, Shane Buechele leads Bills to a 23-19 preseason victory over the Bucs

images.name: Bills edge Bucs 23-19 in preseason finale
images.caption: Shane Buechele threw for 278 yards and a touchdown to lead the Bills to a 23-19 preseason win over the Buccaneers.

video.headline: Bills edge Bucs 23-19 in preseason finale
video.caption: Shane Buechele threw for 278 yards and a touchdown to lead the Bills to a 23-19 preseason win over the Buccaneers.
video.title: Bills edge Bucs 23-19 in preseason finale
video.description: Shane Buechele threw for 278 yards and a touchdown to lead the Bills to a 23-19 preseason win over the Buccaneers.

tracking.trackingName: NFL_One-Play (Bills edge Bucs 23-19 in preseason finale) 2025/08/23 ESHEET

article.story: TAMPA, Fla. -- — Shane Buechele made the most of his first opportunity to play a full game in the NFL, showing 31 other teams what he can do. Buechele threw for 278 yards and one touchdown and the Buffalo Bills beat the Tampa Bay Buccaneers 23-19 on Saturday night. Buechele won't get a chance in Buffalo behind reigning NFL MVP Josh Allen, Mitchell Trubisky and Mike White. But a 25-for-30 performance — albeit against backups — could land him on the practice squad or with another organization. Considering he sat out last year with a neck injury, Buechele is grateful to be back on the field. “Last season was tough from the aspect of not being able to put on pads and working my way to get back, God is good," he said. “Even tonight, God is good. I kept telling myself that every time I went out on the field. It’s my first time ever playing a full game in the NFL and it was a lot of fun.” Allen didn’t play for the Bills (1-2), finishing his first preseason without seeing any game action. Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield also didn’t take any snaps in exhibition games for the first time in his career. With both teams resting starters, players competing for snaps, backup positions and roster spots battled for 60 minutes — except for Buccaneers rookie safety Shilo Sanders. He was ejected for throwing a punch at Zach Davidson in the second quarter. Sanders, the son of Hall of Fame cornerback Deion Sanders, is battling for a roster spot after going undrafted out of Colorado, where he played for his father. He was also penalized for pass interference earlier in the game. “It's inexcusable,” Buccaneers coach Todd Bowles said. Kyle Trask made his case to be Tampa Bay’s backup quarterback, completing 13 of 17 passes for 93 yards and one touchdown. Trask, a second-round pick in 2021, has thrown 11 passes in the regular season in his career. “I thought it was solid,” Trask said. “Control what I can control.” General manager Jason Licht said on the team’s TV broadcast a decision on whether Trask or veteran Teddy Bridgewater will back up Mayfield hasn’t been made yet. Bowles reiterated that after the game. Rookie Connor Bazelak played the second half, going 12 of 19 for 107 yards with a 1-yard TD pass to Garrett Greene in the final two minutes for the Bucs (2-1). Frank Gore Jr. ran 1 yard up the middle for a score to give the Bills a 7-0 lead in the first quarter. Gore had 32 yards rushing and two catches for 29 yards. Bills wide receiver Tyrell Shavers may have boosted his chances of making the team with an excellent, one-handed, diving catch for an 11-yard touchdown over cornerback Bryce Hall, who had tight coverage on the play. Bills coach Sean McDermott also was impressed with Shavers' hustle on special teams. “Those are character plays,” McDermott said. Buccaneers wideout Tez Johnson made the highlight reel for a sensational flip celebrating his 1-yard TD catch that cut Buffalo’s lead to 14-10. Bowles said the seventh-round pick helped his chances of making the team. “Ever since I was drafted, I said I was gonna hit a back flip,” Johnson said. “It felt really good.” Running it back The Buccaneers averaged 38 yards on five kickoff returns. Josh Williams had three returns for an average of 36 yards with a long of 42. Kameron Johnson returned one 57 yards. The Bills had a 31.6-yard average on five kick returns, including a 38-yarder by Laviska Shenault. Bringing the boot Bills tight end Zach Davidson handled the punting duties because punter Brad Robbins was sick. Davidson, a punter at Central Missouri, drilled a 62-yarder on his first try. It was returned 22 yards. His second and last punt went 42 yards and was returned for 5. Injuries Bills: CB Tre’Davious White sustained a lower leg injury in practice this week, according to general manager Brandon Beane. There’s no timeline yet for White’s return. ... Wide receiver Curtis Samuel didn’t make the trip due to an illness. Buccaneers: General manager Jason Licht said on the team’s broadcast that All-Pro left tackle Tristan Wirfs could return to the starting lineup before wide receiver Chris Godwin. Wirfs had knee surgery in the offseason and is expected to miss a few games. Godwin is still recovering from a severe ankle injury suffered in Week 7 last season. Up next Bills: Open the regular season at home against the Baltimore Ravens on “Sunday Night Football” on Sept. 7. Buccaneers: Visit the Atlanta Falcons on Sept. 7. ------ AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl

videos.headline: Connor Bazelak finds Garrett Greene for Bucs TD
videos.description: Connor Bazelak drops a perfect dime to Garett Greene for the touchdown, cutting the Buccaneers' deficit to 23-19 against the Bills.

tracking.trackingName: NFL_One-Play (Connor Bazelak finds Garrett Greene for Bucs TD) 2025/08/23 ESHEET
